intro: Coussapoa dealbata, commonly known as the white-stemmed corymbia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, white bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for cultivation in warmer regions. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its attractive foliage and seasonal floral display.
